name: DoubleTree by Hilton San Jose

reviews.text: This is a large airport hotel. The location is very convenient to both the airport and freeways. The reception staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The Starbucks counter in the lobby was a great place to grab a cup of coffee and quick breakfast. Diamond members receive a $10 voucher for Starbucks or a continental breakfast in the restaurant. I opted for Starbucks both days and could get a pretty big feast for $10.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel
good stay
reviews.text: The rooms are large and spacious. While it wasn't a super-modern renovated room, it was in good condition, clean and comfortable. It was also very quiet, especially considering I was overlooking the freeway.
While I wouldn't stay here for a romantic get-a-way or special occassion, it is a fine business hotel and I will consider staying here on future trips.
reviews.title: perfectly fine, but nothing special

reviews.text: room was available early. Food was good. Room was spacious, clean and welcoming. Good conference facilities.
reviews.title: great staycation

reviews.text: The property is convenient to the airport and nearby major roads. Planes take off and land away from the property, and the rooms facing the airport actually seem a bit more quiet than the ones facing the roads on the other side of the property. Service was fine with check-in and check-out.
reviews.title: Overall good stay, but a few quirks

reviews.text: The hotel was great! Clean, friendly staff, great bar and nightclub. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Great food.
reviews.title: excellant

reviews.text: I stayed overnight on Friday evening while attending my daughter's graduation from Santa Clara University. I was joined by two 85 year olds...my mother and my ex mother-in-law. When we pulled up to the entrance, we found that valet parking was $18 per day, although only $9 on Friday and Saturday. When we decided to self park, the valet informed us that the distance to the elevators would be much less from the self parking lot than it would be from the front of the hotel. This was welcomed information since I was handling the luggage for all three of us!
reviews.title: A few hiccups but a nice hotel overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I left the grandmothers in the car and went in to register. That went fairly efficiently and I was back at the car and driving them to the self park lot before too long. Sure enough, it was a short walk for them to the elevators. When we went to our rooms, however, we found that our two rooms were on opposite sides of the floor! I had requested rooms within close proximity, although not necessarily right next door. But when we stepped off the elevator, one of our rooms was to the left and down a long hall, and the other was to the right and around a corner. So I left the grandmothers sharing a chair outside the elevator while I went downstairs and back to the registration desk. We were then given adjoining rooms...and their decadent chocolate chip cookies that we did not receive on the initial check-in.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Pleasant Stay; Seems Ideal for business

reviews.text: When I got upstairs, I found that the key cards had not been re-keyed when the rooms were reassigned. So the grandmothers situated themselves once more on the single chair near the elevators while I trooped back down to the lobby once again. Third time was the charm and we finally made it into our rooms. The rooms were spacious, clean and quiet, even those ours overlooked the freeway. The remote in one of the rooms didn't work, but housekeeping was called and they were down and had it working within 30 minutes.
reviews.title: No problems here

reviews.text: We were all starving, so we headed downstairs for a bite to eat. It was a few minutes past 8 pm, and the 'lighter fare" restaurant had just closed. We then had the option of eating mostly greasy type finger food in the lounge area, or eating in the upper scale Spensers. We opted for Spensers, with two us ordering only appetizers. I had the Spenser salad that was enough of a meal for me. The others ordered the halibut dinner and the crab cakes appetizer. Everyone was content with their meal.
reviews.title: great to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check Coupons online, instead of free internet there is a charge but the coupon gives you 24 hour free internet. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were quite despite heavy traffic area. 7 minutes to airport.
reviews.title: Stayed there prior to taking flight from San Jose next day. Printing boarding passes easy in front lobby.

reviews.text: First the negatives: We were initially put off by the steep parking rates ($18 weekdays and $9 weekends, plus tax) whereas all other hotels we had stayed at had free parking for guests. They refused to apply weekend rates beyond Sunday night even though Monday (May 31, '09) was Memorial Day. They also charge nearly $13 per day for internet access in rooms, though Wifi and internet terminals are free in the lobby area. I tried negotiating a lower parking rate with a nearby establishment, and to my surprise they graciously allowed us to park all four days of our stay without any charge.
reviews.title: Somewhat greedy and stingy management, but great rooms and good service

reviews.text: (Tip: they have some parking spaces for registering guests opposite the main entrance that we used on occasion for a few minutes to drop into our room without objections by the staff, since we didn't opt for their paid parking.)
reviews.title: Hotel hosted Detox pool party ruined my and my kid’s stay..!

reviews.text: They also seemed a little tight on supplies - no plastic laundry bags and restricted toiletries. But housekeeping did willingly replenish all supplies on our casual request while leaving our room and passing them in the hallway. No fridge or microwave in rooms, or complimentary freebies like breakfast or coffee or drinks in common areas. Old CRT TVs in rooms but they worked fine.
reviews.title: Nice Room

reviews.text: Go for even numbered rooms, or those with last two digits of 35 or below. The East facing rooms - odd numbered with last two digits of 41 and above - overlook the busy 101 highway so traffic sounds may bother you.
reviews.title: Great rates and great hotel... I wouldn't...

reviews.text: This hotel combines convenient location with well-maintained facilities, excellent business amenities, several attractive dining and entertainment options, and (most important of all!) truly outstanding signature chocolate chip cookies. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone - great value at a reasonable price point. Not to mention those cookies ... !!!!!
reviews.title: Clean, convenient hotel provides friendly, efficient service at a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. It was very quiet, both from the neighboring rooms and the inherent inside noise that often can come from the air conditioning etc. Our son is at college close by so we have tried several hotels in the area. They were all either too noisy (thin walls or noisy in room units) or older accomodations or too pricey for what we were looking for. The location was close to the University, Santana Row and restaurants, and they have a small shop and food conveniently located at the hotel also.
reviews.title: The Doubletree provided a great nights sleep!

reviews.text: Parking was expensive at $18 per day, however since we had a car load of his possessions from college, we appreciated the gated parking area.
reviews.title: Convienient, comfortable and clean

reviews.text: There is no refrigerator in the room - but the ice bucket worked well.
reviews.title: Our delightful stay at the Doubletree

reviews.text: There is a second sink area outside the toilet and shower area so we could all get going quickly in the morning.
reviews.title: Great place for the price

aka: Doubletree By Hilton San Jose Hotel
description: Convenient Silicon Valley location, Doubletree Hotel San Jose is close to the San Jose Airport and a short drive from Downtown or Santana Row. Doubletree boasts the largest guest rooms as well as 48,000 sq. ft. of meeting space. This hotel is the perfect destination for family travel, corporate meetings, or an elegant wedding. Friendly staff and a warm chocolate chip cookie at check in make it feel like home.
